comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Woodson seems to have written a book, judging from this citation: Woodson, Urey (1939). 'The First New Dealer'. Louisville, Kentucky: The Standard Press. (at Google Books it is listed as: The First New Dealer, William Goebel: His Origin, Ambitions, Achievements, His Assassination, Loss to the State and Nation; the Story of A Great Crime, By Urey Woodson] Woodson, Urey (1859-1939) — of Owensboro, Daviess County, Ky. Democrat. Newspaper editor and publisher; Kentucky railroad commissioner, 1891-95; member of Democratic National Committee from Kentucky, 1896-1912, 1916-18, 1924-28; delegate to Democratic National Convention from Kentucky, 1932. Presbyterian. Interment at Elmwood Cemetery, Owensboro, Ky. politicalgraveyard.com/bio/woodside-woodville.html#S9Q1ASTH3

comment._content:
The Democratic National Convention of 1912 ran from June 25 to July 2, 1912.

The official report can be read online at the Internet Archive.
